input.label: Host
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | dedup orig_host | sort orig_host

html.div:
This dashboard is designed to highlight the configuration of any volumes (shared paths for index storage) which may exist in the deployment. The Splunk daemon will emit a warning if an index is configured to use the same path as an existing volume if the index is not a member of that volume. See here for more information about using volumes.
In the panel titled Index Counts two numbers are listed. These counts represent the total number of indexes found (on the right) and the number of those which are utilizing volume definitions for indexed data (on the left).
Note: Hosts making use of volume configurations for neither homePath nor coldPath will not reflect any entries here. There is a default volume titled _splunk_summaries which can be used to set a cap on the size of accelerated data models. This dashboard is concerned only with volumes used for index storage.
The volume definitions (if any are found--this includes the default _splunk_summaries mentioned above) will be displayed in the panel titled Volume Definitions Found. The salient qualities of a volume are its path and configured limit (if any). This panel also attempts to correlate with the partitions found on the system, to provide a hint whether the volume (partition) is oversubscribed.
The next row features two panels which are intrinsically linked. The first is Indexes Using Volumes. This panel shows a list of indexes (and the host on which they reside) that are making use of a volume for either homePath or coldPath or both. By contrast, Indexes Not Using Volumes is the converse; it shows indexes that are not using volumes at all.
The bottom panel, titled Volume Configuration Warnings shows any warnings emitted by the Splunk daemon regarding volume configuration. This would occur when a volume is defined for a given path, and other indexes are utilizing that path, but not using a volume. The warning from Splunk indicates that the named index will not participate in the shared storage limit that the volume defines. If the index definition is adjusted to correct this, the subsequent restart will "clear" the warning shown in this panel.

single.searchString: | rest /services/data/indexes `_fb_use_or_ignore(splunk_server, $host$)` | search coldPath=volume:* OR homePath=volume:* | stats dc(title) AS count

table.title: Volume Definitions Found
table.searchString: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/configs/conf-indexes `_fb_use_or_ignore(splunk_server, $host$)` | search title=volume:* | fields splunk_server, title, path, maxVolumeDataSizeMB | join type=left [| rest /services/server/status/partitions-space `_fb_use_or_ignore(splunk_server, $host$)` | table splunk_server, mount_point, capacity] | eval volume_mount=if(match(path, "^" . mount_point . ".*"), mount_point, "Unknown") | eval capacity=if(volume_mount="Unknown", "N/A", capacity) | eval pct_subscribed=round(maxVolumeDataSizeMB * 100 / round(capacity), 2) | fillnull value="N/A" pct_subscribed | fields splunk_server, title, path, volume_mount, maxVolumeDataSizeMB, capacity, pct_subscribed | rename splunk_server AS Indexer, title AS Volume, path AS Path, volume_mount AS "Filesystem", maxVolumeDataSizeMB AS Limit, capacity AS "Filesystem Capacity", pct_subscribed AS "Subscription Percentage"

table.title: Indexes Using Volumes
table.searchString: | rest /services/data/indexes `_fb_use_or_ignore(splunk_server, $host$)` | search coldPath=volume:* OR homePath=volume:* | fields splunk_server, title, homePath, coldPath | rename splunk_server AS Indexer, title AS Index, homePath AS "Home Path", coldPath AS "Cold Path"

table.title: Indexes Not Using Volumes
table.searchString: | rest /services/data/indexes `_fb_use_or_ignore(splunk_server, $host$)` | search coldPath!=volume:* homePath!=volume:* | fields splunk_server, title, homePath, coldPath | rename splunk_server AS Indexer, title AS Index, homePath AS "Home Path", coldPath AS "Cold Path"

table.title: Volume Configuration Warnings
table.searchString: index=_internal source=*splunkd.log* host=$host$ (component=IndexConfig idx inside config error) OR (component=loader starting) | rex "volume=(?<volume>\w+)\s" | eval volume="volume:" . volume | rex "homePath='(?<homePath_expanded>.+?)'" | rex "coldPath='(?<coldPath_expanded>.+?)'" | eval state=case(isnotnull(homePath_expanded), "Home (Hot + Warm)", isnotnull(coldPath_expanded), "Cold", 1=1, "unknown") | eval path=coalesce(homePath_expanded, coldPath_expanded, "NULL?") | eval idx=if(component!="IndexConfig", "RESTART", idx) | stats values(volume) AS volume, values(state) AS state, values(path) AS Directories, max(_time) AS mytime, max(eval(if(component!="IndexConfig", _time, 0))) AS last_start by host, idx | eventstats max(last_start) AS host_restart by host | where mytime>host_restart | fields - mytime last_start host_restart
